sfftk.formats package¶

AmiraMesh module¶

sfftk.formats.am¶

User-facing reader classes for AmiraMesh files

class sfftk.formats.am.AmiraMeshSegmentation(fn, *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: sfftk.formats.base.Segmentation

Class representing an AmiraMesh segmentation

from sfftk.formats.am import AmiraMeshSegmentation
am_seg = AmiraMeshSegmentation('file.am')
convert(args, *_args, **_kwargs)¶

Convert to sfftk.schema.SFFSegmentation object

header¶

The AmiraMesh header obtained using the ahds package

The header is wrapped with a generic AmiraMeshHeader class

segments¶

Segments in this segmentation

class sfftk.formats.am.AmiraMeshHeader(header)¶

Bases: sfftk.formats.base.Header

Class defining the header of an AmiraMesh segmentation file

convert(*args, **kwargs)¶

Convert an AmiraMeshHeader object into an EMDB-SFF segmentation header

Currently empty

class sfftk.formats.am.AmiraMeshSegment(fn, header, segment_id)¶

Bases: sfftk.formats.base.Segment

Segment class

annotation¶

Segment annotation

convert()¶

Convert to sfftk.schema.SFFSegment object

material¶

Material may or may not exist. Return None if it doesn’t and the caller will determine what to do

volume¶

The segmentation as a volume

class sfftk.formats.am.AmiraMeshAnnotation(material)¶

Bases: sfftk.formats.base.Annotation

Annotation class

colour¶

Segment colour

Colour may or may not exist. Return None if it doesn’t and the caller will determine what to do

convert()¶

Convert to sfftk.schema.SFFBiologicalAnnotation object

description¶

Segment description

class sfftk.formats.am.AmiraMeshContours(z_segment)¶

Bases: sfftk.formats.base.Contours

Contour container class

Warning

Deprecated since version 0.6.0a4: AmiraMesh segments are now represented as 3D volumes

convert()¶

Convert to sfftk.schema.SFFContourList object

Convert to sfftk.schema.SFFMesh object

class sfftk.formats.am.AmiraMeshVolume(fn, header)¶

Bases: sfftk.formats.base.Volume

Class defining the 3D volume of an AmiraMesh segmentation file

Parameters:
  • fn (str) – name of the AmiraMesh segmentation file
  • header – AmiraMeshHeader object
convert()¶

Convert to sfftk.schema.SFFThreeDVolume object

IMOD module¶

sfftk.formats.mod¶

User-facing reader classes for IMOD files

class sfftk.formats.mod.IMODSegmentation(fn, *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: sfftk.formats.base.Segmentation

Class representing an IMOD segmentation

from sfftk.formats.mod import IMODSegmentation
mod_seg = IMODSegmentation('file.mod')
convert(args, *_args, **_kwargs)¶

Method to convert an IMOD file to a sfftk.schema.SFFSegmentation object

has_mesh_or_shapes¶

Check whether the segmentation has meshes or shapes

If it only has contours this property is False Do not convert segmentations that only have contours

header¶

Header in segmentation

segments¶

Segments in segmentation

class sfftk.formats.mod.IMODHeader(segmentation)¶

Bases: sfftk.formats.base.Header

Class definition for the header in an IMOD segmentation file

convert(*args, **kwargs)¶

Convert to an EMDB-SFF segmentation header object

Currently not implemented

class sfftk.formats.mod.IMODContours(header, conts)¶

Bases: sfftk.formats.base.Contours

Contours class

Warning

Deprecated since version 0.6.0a4: IMOD contour segments should be converted to meshes using

~$ imodmesh [options] file.mod
convert()¶

Convert to sfftk.schema.SFFContourList object

class sfftk.formats.mod.IMODShapes(header, objt)¶

Container class for shapes

class sfftk.formats.mod.IMODShape¶

Bases: object

Base class for IMOD shapes

convert(*args, **kwargs)¶

Convert this shape into an EMDB-SFF shape object

transform¶

The transform associated with the shape

Is used to place (transform) the shape in the volume

Header class

The image-to-physical transform

The path to the original segmented map

The name of segmentation

All parent IDs

All region IDs

root_parent_ids¶

Parent IDs for root segments

The version of Segger used
